DOC.brief_title: Chart Review Efficacy GenesisPlus 1064 nm Nd : YAG Laser Treatment Onychomycosis
DOC.detailed_description: This retrospective , open-label , single-centre study collection clinical data efficacy safety Cutera® GenesisPlus 1064 nm Nd : YAG laser treatment nail fungus ( onychomycosis ) . Safety efficacy treatment GenesisPlus laser evaluate ( 1 ) assessment subject 's great toenail photograph baseline two treatment GenesisPlus Laser utilize planimetry measurement infect vs. clear nail area target toenail photograph , ( 2 ) clinical subjective review acute follow adverse event may result laser treatment target toenail .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male Female subject , age 18 80 year ( inclusive ) . 2 . Subject clinical diagnosis onychomycosis one great toenails baseline . 3 . Subject positive potassium hydroxide ( KOH ) stain and/or fungal culture . 4 . Subject baseline post treatment digital photograph target great toenail . 5 . Subjects provide informed consent treatment nail Cutera GenesisPlus laser system . 1 . Subjects receive laser treatment infected great toenail ( ) nonCutera® laser system within twelve ( 12 ) month prior Cutera® GenesisPlus laser treatment . 2 . Subjects history clinical diagnosis moccasin type tinea pedis , lichen planus , psoriasis bacterial nail infection . 3 . Subjects history clinical diagnosis coexist disorder may potentially demonstrate nail manifestation . 4 . Systemic antifungal medication within six ( 6 ) month prior follow Cutera® GenesisPlus laser treatment . 5 . Subjects history clinical diagnosis repetitive nail trauma prior treatment . 6 . Subjects participate clinical research study within thirty ( 30 ) day prior within 210 day follow final Cutera® GenesisPlus laser treatment . 7 . Subjects pregnant breastfeeding .
